passage.text_1: Murray Gell-Mann, a theoretical physicist, is known for his work on the theory of elementary particles. He introduced the concept of quarks, which are the building blocks of protons, neutrons, and other particles. Gell-Mann's quark model has become a fundamental part of understanding the structure and interactions of subatomic particles.
passage.text_2: Gell-Mann's work has been influential in the development of the standard model of particle physics. The standard model is a comprehensive theory that describes the makeup of matter and how it interacts through various forces. It incorporates his quark model, along with the discovery of various other particles and forces, to provide a comprehensive framework for understanding the fundamental components of the universe.

question: Based on the texts, how would the author of Text 2 most likely respond to Gell-Mann's quark model discussed in Text 1?

choices.A: By emphasizing the importance of Gell-Mann's quark model in the development of other scientific theories.
choices.B: By acknowledging the significance of Gell-Mann's quark model as a fundamental part of the standard model of particle physics.
choices.C: By arguing that Gell-Mann's quark model is outdated and has been replaced by more advanced theories.
choices.D: By suggesting that Gell-Mann's quark model is only one of many competing theories that seek to explain the structure of subatomic particles.

explanation: B: 'By acknowledging the significance of Gell-Mann's quark model as a fundamental part of the standard model of particle physics.' is the correct answer because Text 2 states that the standard model incorporates Gell-Mann's quark model and provides a comprehensive framework for understanding the fundamental components of the universe.
distractor_explanation: 'By emphasizing the importance of Gell-Mann's quark model in the development of other scientific theories.' is incorrect because Text 2 does not mention the development of other scientific theories.
'By arguing that Gell-Mann's quark model is outdated and has been replaced by more advanced theories.' is incorrect because Text 2 does not suggest that the quark model has been replaced.

'By suggesting that Gell-Mann's quark model is only one of many competing theories that seek to explain the structure of subatomic particles.' is incorrect because Text 2 does not mention competing theories.
